bibl.title: Cratinus, Menander, and the Daphne Mosaic.
bibl.note: Argues that Cratinus' Wine Flask provides an interpretative lens for understanding a mid-third century A.D. mosaic from the House of Menander in Daphne, now in the Princeton Art Museum. The mosaic depicts Menander reclining on a couch with his lover seated next to him, and with a personified Comedy standing demurely off to the side.
